In that case GitHUb offers a `noreply` email for this purpose. You can read more [here](https://docs.github.com/en/account-and-profile/setting-up-and-managing-your-personal-account-on-github/managing-email-preferences/setting-your-commit-email-address). ::: and you can verify your settings by using the following command : ```bash git config --list ``` Here is the output on my machine : ![Output of git-config command](git-config-output.png) ## Beginner's workflow | Git command | Description | | :---: | :---:| | git init | Title | | git add | Text | | git commit | Text | ## Work with branches ## Working with others ## Git and GitHub ## Other topics ## Acknowledgements {.appendix} Image by Daniel Skovran from Pixabay
